comments:
[M4]

For the first time in a long time, I've got a stack trace on my Java console,
and I'm pleasantly surprised to see that it's a link, which should presumably
take me to the right place. Unfortunately, instead I get an error:

"Source not found for mypackage.MyClass" 

(Names have been changed to protect the guilty.)

Now clearly JDT itself knows about the source for this, because hitting
Ctrl-Shift-T and entering MyClass finds mypackage.MyClass.

The stack trace is of the form:

java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at mypackage.MyClass.setAttribute(MyClass.java:269)

(The tab shows as 4 columns on the console, btw.)

Is there anything different I should be doing to get this to work? It looks like
it'd be a very nice feature if it were working properly.

Hmm... having now started debugging normally, that couldn't find the source
either. It turns out that although the "default source path" was set in the
"Run..." launcher configuration, it wasn't being picked up. I'll check whether
stack traces in the console now work too...

Yup, console stack trace now works.

So, there may be a problem lurking about default source paths not being followed
appropriately, which may in turn be a milestone-upgrade related bug - feel free
to recategorise, close, or whatever you want to do. Sorry for being a PITA!
